title: Enlarging the Stokes shift of CuInS2 quantum dots using thiol–ene polymers for efficient large-area luminescent solar concentrators
content:
Energy Environ. Sci., 2024, 17,6338-6349
DOI: 10.1039/D4EE02603A, Paper
Yufan Wu, Jing Huang, Jianyang Zang, Jingjian Zhou, Changhong Cheng, Zhuang Hu, Dan Shan, Wenxing Yang, Ilya Sychugov, Licheng Sun, Bo Xu
A thiol–ene polymer is employed to enlarge the Stokes shift of CuInS2/ZnS quantum dots for application in luminescent solar concentrators (LSCs), and a certified record power conversion efficiency of 1.36% (area of 29 × 29 cm2) was achieved.
